channel.title: What are you doing on RuneScape?
channel.description:
This board hasn't been too active lately (besides the fact that people are creating several useless topics about voting for the 2007 server), so I figured I would create a topic to see what everyone else is doing on RuneScape.
I'm currently trying to get 80 Dungeoneering for a Chaotic weapon, although I'm not too sure which I should get; I know that the weapon will either be a Chaotic Maul or Chaotic Rapier. What do you guys think?

item.title: What are you doing on RuneScape?
item.dc:creator: @B2300_T4nk B2300 T4nk
item.description:
@B2300_T4nk wrote:

Looking at the EoC bar with disgust.

Get a rapier/cls. Way more efficient.

Read full topic

item.title: What are you doing on RuneScape?
item.dc:creator: @Pink_Phat Pink Phat
item.description:
@Pink_Phat wrote:

Probably going to get a few more skills to level 80. Got woodcutting and firemaking to level 80, and runecrafting 99 (thanks to runespan and members it’s basically a walk in the park). But I only have about 45m, so I’ll have to use it wisely.

Read full topic
item.source: What are you doing on RuneScape?

item.title: What are you doing on RuneScape?
item.dc:creator: @Tutorial Tutorial
item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:

[quote=“Flame_, post:9, topic:490088”][quote author=Tutorial link=topic=608321.msg4230388#msg4230388 date=1361225636]

I’m still debating. If you checked the market, ashes have gone up considerably in price. And since I’ve cut all of my logs, and have about 8 maples remaining (I’m f2p currently), I can make a decent profit if I go hardcore. (approximately 3m)
Then again, I could gain more XP from doing bonfires, and it’s a lot faster. I can also access the bank quicker doing bonfires.

I would only suggest doing the hardcore method if you are planning to stay a non-member. I had to do the hardcore way regardless, because I got mine like two years ago.
[/quote]
I’ll consider it.
Also, I’ve got 10m, and I’m extremely low in terms of combat, but have 67 woodcutting and 84 firemaking. Any ideas on what I could spend some geepee on?[/quote]
As a non-member, your options are really slim, but I do recommend you train your combat stats.

Read full topic
item.source: What are you doing on RuneScape?

item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

[quote=“Tutorial, post:7, topic:490088”][quote author=Flame_ link=topic=608321.msg4230378#msg4230378 date=1361224738]
I’m still debating. If you checked the market, ashes have gone up considerably in price. And since I’ve cut all of my logs, and have about 8 maples remaining (I’m f2p currently), I can make a decent profit if I go hardcore. (approximately 3m)
Then again, I could gain more XP from doing bonfires, and it’s a lot faster. I can also access the bank quicker doing bonfires.
[/quote]
I would only suggest doing the hardcore method if you are planning to stay a non-member. I had to do the hardcore way regardless, because I got mine like two years ago.[/quote]
I’ll consider it.
Also, I’ve got 10m, and I’m extremely low in terms of combat, but have 67 woodcutting and 84 firemaking. Any ideas on what I could spend some geepee on?

Read full topic

item.description:

Do you plan on using the hardcore firemaking methods, or just do bonfires?
